intro: Stellaria lanata, commonly known as hairy starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white or pinkish star-shaped flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. Native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with opposite, lanceolate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its seeds are small and capsule-like, dispersing via wind or water, contributing to its widespread distribution.
